greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n where every part appears at least 4 times.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (terms n=1..967 from R. H. Hardin)
example: a(12) = 4 because we have 3333, 2^6, 22221111, and 1^(12). - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 24 2009
maple: g := product(1+x^(4*j)/(1-x^j), j = 1..30): gser := series(g, x = 0, 85): seq(coeff(gser, x, n), n = 0..66); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 24 2009
mathematica: nmax = 100; CoefficientList[Series[Product[1 + x^(4*k)/(1-x^k), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Nov 28 2015; offset adapted by _Georg Fischer_, Sep 18 2020 *)
results.author: _R. H. Hardin_, Jun 01 2009
ext: Initial terms changed to match b-file. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 31 2009
